intro: Alyxia ecostata, commonly known as the coastal alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a shrub that typically grows in coastal areas, characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a leathery texture. Alyxia ecostata is well adapted to sandy soils and salt spray, making it a hardy plant in coastal environments.
